title: When you know the loss was genuinely your fault...
body:
Ever know so well that the game went downhill because it was practically your fault? Because you became in the lead at 5 minutes and then do a series of stupid things because you were cocky. You lose the good lead and turn the game around quickly and when you lose, you know its all because of you in the beginning. 

Worse part is when your team doesnt flame you. They know its your fault and you can feel their non-existent flaming on you in chat. And you lose the game in guilt knowing what you did wrong that ended so poorly... *ward.*

replies.body: Me? Never! It's always their fault!
I like how the people who downvoted you have 0 feel for sarcasm.

Mostly it's like that:
"Ah ok that was dumb.
Well ok... it's just 2 people dead because of me... could be worse"

And then enemy team makes Baron while they are 5 vs 3 and win the game because of that.

# SHAME! SHAME! SHAME! dingdingding
~~Winter is coming~~

>When you know the loss was genuinely your fault...

You have to spam "better Jungle wins", in case that you were the Jng you change it to "better Bot wins"
But maybe you are Canadian Jungler and write "better Jungle wins" honestly.
Jesus fucking christ, this is too fucking real.

Losing when you do good and your team are complete monkeys feels really bad and its really disappoint but losing because you played poorly and its blatantly obvious to you is beyond disappointing. It feels like youre a failure, it really hits your self esteem.

Honestly I'd rather lose because of my team feeding their ass off than losing because I dragged my team down when they were doing good.
Add to that some assholes that just want to rub in their victory with 'gg ez'

> [{quoted}](name=Saianna,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hlEbaqGE,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2019-03-26T09:49:41.214+0000)
>
> Add to that some assholes that just want to rub in their victory with 'gg ez'

i want to bite their head off when they say gg when our team has three to four 0/15/0 players 
{{sticker:sg-ahri-1}}

about 20 days ago I made a thread about making 'gg ez' as reportable offense. It's nothing more than being an asshole. Looks like almost noone agreed with me. Yet for some reason they believe that calling someone a (this is just an example, calm down) '%%%%%'(<- black person) in game suddenly is the worst crime in 2019. This doesnt affect how you play. they dont know who you are, so why it matters? Seriously, who cares... Ugh.. It's so weird
Honestly if it were possible to assault somebody through a PC screen, competitive PVP games would become warfare. {{sticker:darius-angry}}
I wish more people understood this

Usually, it's more

https://i.redd.it/8wx7adtu5jm01.png

_[People don't give honours anymore.](https://matchhistory.eune.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/EUN1/2155556304/201309331?tab=overview)_

That said, when I once was _told_ to play Yasuo and with 2 augments in Odyssey, after saying twice I didn't want to play him...well, too bad they didn't say I had to actually use my ult or have any items in the final fight.

We would have easily won that Universal Legends mission, thanks to THE best RNG I had ever seen, but...it's okay. I don't want to win by doing things I don't want to.

https://eune.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/special-event/learn-more-odyssey#missions
This is me playing Ezreal. Then again, I'm pretty bad and that I play too conservatively with him.

Fortunately these days if someone misses a cannon or dies once early they go full reeeee mode and afk or start inting, so real players aren't at fault as often. 

In all seriousness though, yeah it sucks when this happens, but you have to put things in perspective. I used to play with a friend who'd lose his mind anytime something bad happened even if our team was winning overall. One day we were playing and another friend got fed up and said "why do you even play if there's always the chance we're not going to win" and that's basically been my philosophy since. I won't always win, occasionally I'll get obliterated so hard I'll be the main cause of our loss, but that's always a risk inherent to playing a 5v5 team game with a 50% win chance.

I more of run into the issue of playing an almost flawless game the first 20 minutes while my team feeds but somehow my team comes back and starts doing well and then I make a really stupid mistake late game and we auto lose the game. I'm like anti-clutch or something.

Feelsbad.

> [{quoted}](name=UniSect,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hlEbaqGE,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-03-26T07:38:18.621+0000)
>
> Ever know so well that the game went downhill because it was practically your fault? Because you became in the lead at 5 minutes and then do a series of stupid things because you were cocky. You lose the good lead and turn the game around quickly and when you lose, you know its all because of you in the beginning. 
> 
> Worse part is when your team doesnt flame you. They know its your fault and you can feel their non-existent flaming on you in chat. And you lose the game in guilt knowing what you did wrong that ended so poorly... *ward.*

Like so many of my Shyvana games. I'd have amazing ganks, get fed, try to shove down entire lanes, get so far, but I wouldn't wait for my team and try to 1v3 (cause it worked 5 min ago!), keep wondering why it's suddenly not working, and end up leaving my team destitute and unable to defend themselves while the enemy just takes objectives while I'm respawning.... {{sticker:sg-ahri-1}}
Always flame the jungler! It’s always their fault! Oh wait... that’s me ....
Warding? I don't _SEE_ the point.
ward nerfs hit too hard though. sometimes control is free gold to them.

It feels pretty sucky, yeah. I'm just glad some people can be humble about it, though. I beat myself up a bit too hard about it, but I think it's just a generally good mindset to try and care more about what you did wrong than what your team did wrong.

Always a Feelsbad moment. It feels worse when they honor you or when you're winning but then lose on your mistake.

I had a game once where my friend fed the enemy rengo and it looked like a loss straight out. I managed to bring it back and we hit late game. We almost won, but I made a mistake on the last team fight that let them win that fight and the game. I got 4 tilt proofs and it made me feel like crap cuz I knew it was on me lol.
On a serious note, I feel like every time I play terribly I end up getting carried to victory. Maybe its just selective memory or something.
Getting 10 kills at toplane doing 1v2 and 1v3 while pushing and the rest of the team dying while i get all the pressure. They ended at 18
Me when I get fed as GP in normals.
atleast i got chicken.
True, some very rare times it's my fault, nobody's perfect i can't have everything.

Then looks at o/20 bot lane.
Pjew what a relief...
Feels worst than being inted by your teammates.
If only it wasnt just 1 person doing it.

> [{quoted}](name=UniSect,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hlEbaqGE,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-03-26T07:38:18.621+0000)
>
> Ever know so well that the game went downhill because it was practically your fault? Because you became in the lead at 5 minutes and then do a series of stupid things because you were cocky. You lose the good lead and turn the game around quickly and when you lose, you know its all because of you in the beginning. 
> 
> Worse part is when your team doesnt flame you. They know its your fault and you can feel their non-existent flaming on you in chat. And you lose the game in guilt knowing what you did wrong that ended so poorly... *ward.*

i felt this before s9 in s8 and s7 but this season is such a fiesta with such a bullshit hardscore matchmaking system puting silver and challenger playeres in one game and TROLLS roll over games like zombies that u never get to feel that season 9 in league of legend is world war Z 3 basically.
